docs.name: Foreman
docs.info: Foreman API v2 is currently the default API version.

apis.short_description: List all hosts for a host group

params.name: id
params.validator: Must be an identifier, string from 1 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, dot(.), space, underscore(_), hypen(-) with no leading or trailing space.

params.name: environment_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: ip
params.description: not required if using a subnet with DHCP proxy

params.name: mac
params.description: required for managed host that is bare metal, not required if it’s a virtual machine

params.name: architecture_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: domain_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: puppet_class_ids
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: operatingsystem_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: medium_id
params.description: required if not imaged based provisioning and host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: ptable_id
params.description: required if host is managed and custom partition has not been defined

params.name: subnet_id
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group

params.name: root_pass
params.description: required if host is managed and value is not inherited from host group or default password in settings

params.name: owner_type
params.validator: Must be one of: User, Usergroup.

params.name: host_parameters_attributes
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: managed
params.description: True/False flag whether a host is managed or unmanaged. Note: this value also determines whether several parameters are required or not

params.name: progress_report_id
params.description: UUID to track orchestration tasks status, GET /api/orchestration/:UUID/tasks

params.name: interfaces_attributes
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: mac
params.description: MAC address of interface. Required for managed interfaces on bare metal.

params.name: type
params.description: Interface type, e.g. bmc. Default is interface
params.validator: Must be one of: interface, bmc, bond, bridge.

params.name: domain_id
params.description: Foreman domain ID of interface. Required for primary interfaces on managed hosts.

params.name: managed
params.description: Should this interface be managed via DHCP and DNS smart proxy and should it be configured during provisioning?

params.name: primary
params.description: Should this interface be used for constructing the FQDN of the host? Each managed hosts needs to have one primary interface.

params.name: provision
params.description: Should this interface be used for TFTP of PXELinux (or SSH for image-based hosts)? Each managed hosts needs to have one provision interface.

params.name: provider
params.description: Interface provider, e.g. IPMI. Only for BMC interfaces.

params.name: tag
params.description: VLAN tag, this attribute has precedence over the subnet VLAN ID. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: attached_to
params.description: Identifier of the interface to which this interface belongs, e.g. eth1. Only for virtual interfaces.

params.name: mode
params.description: Bond mode of the interface, e.g. balance-rr. Only for bond interfaces.
params.validator: Must be one of: balance-rr, active-backup, balance-xor, broadcast, 802.3ad, balance-tlb, balance-alb.

params.name: attached_devices
params.description: Identifiers of attached interfaces, e.g. ['eth1', 'eth2']. For bond interfaces those are the slaves. Only for bond and bridges interfaces.
params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.name: bond_options
params.description: Space separated options, e.g. miimon=100. Only for bond interfaces.

params.name: compute_attributes
params.description: Additional compute resource specific attributes for the interface.

params.name: id
params.validator: string from 2 to 128 characters containing only alphanumeric characters, space, '_', '-' with no leading or trailing space..

domains.name: Domains
domains.full_description: Foreman considers a domain and a DNS zone as the same thing. That is, if you are planning to manage a site where all the machines are or the form hostname.somewhere.com then the domain is somewhere.com. This allows Foreman to associate a puppet variable with a domain/site and automatically append this variable to all external node requests made by machines at that site.

The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).

for example http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch where $arch will be substituted for the host’s actual OS architecture and $version, $major and $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system.

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release.

methods.name: bulk_search
methods.full_description: For every search it returns the list of tasks that satisfty the condition. The reason for supporting multiple searches is the UI that might be ending needing periodic updates on task status for various searches at the same time. This way, it is possible to get all the task statuses with one request.

params.description: List of uuids to fetch info about
params.validator: Must be an Array of nested elements

params.name: task_id

params.validator: Must be an array of any type

params.description: Number of results per page to return

lifecycle_environments.name: Lifecycle environments
lifecycle_environments.full_description:
Description

An environment is a basic organization structure that groups systems, products, repositories, etc. Every system belongs to one environment and it’s isolated inside so that it can see only content that is in its environment.

Chains

Environments are ordered into chains and their content (propducts, repositories, tempaltes, packages) can be moved to an environment only from its prior environment. You can have for example chain like:

Library -> Development -> Testing -> Production

Each change in an environment is done through a changeset in an action called promotion.

Library

Library is a special environment that has no ascendant: All the content starts in this environment. More chains can start from the library environment but no further branching of a chain is enabled.

params.name: library
params.description: set true if you want to see only library environments
params.validator: Must be one of: true, false.

apis.short_description: Create an environment in an organization

params.name: prior
params.description: ID of an environment that is prior to the new environment in the chain. It has to be either the ID of Library or the ID of an environment at the end of a chain. This param exists for backwards compatibility purposes. Please use prior_id.

params.name: prior_id
params.description: ID of an environment that is prior to the new environment in the chain. It has to be either the ID of Library or the ID of an environment at the end of a chain.

apis.short_description: Update an environment in an organization

params.name: new_name
params.description: new name to be given to the environment
